name: df-madu
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6
body: |- wceq(cmadu, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, universe, cmpt(s2, cfv(cbs, co(cv(s0), cmat, cv(s1))), cmpo(s3, s4, cv(s0), cv(s0), cfv(co(cv(s0), cmdat, cv(s1)), cmpo(s5, s6, cv(s0), cv(s0), cif(cif(cfv(cur, cv(s1)), cfv(c0g, cv(s1)), wceq(cv(s6), cv(s3))), co(cv(s5), cv(s2), cv(s6)), wceq(cv(s5), cv(s4)))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ maAdju =(s0 ‚àà ùïå, s1 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s2 ‚àà(Base `(s0[Mat]s1))‚Ü¶(s3 ‚àà s0, s4 ‚àà s0 ‚Ü¶((s0[maDet]s1)`(s5 ‚àà s0, s6 ‚àà s0 ‚Ü¶ if(s5 = s4, if(s6 = s3,(1r ` s1),(0 ` s1)),(s5[s2]s6)))))))
comment: Define the adjugate or adjunct (matrix of cofactors) of a square matrix. This definition gives the standard cofactors, however the internal minors are not the standard minors, see definition in [Lang] p. 518. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 7-Sep-2015.) (Revised by SO, 10-Jul-2018.)
